unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: ${ \chi}^{2}$ Independence: Relationships or Grades?
question_text: A student wondered if there was an association between relationship status and overall letter grade (based on grade point average) at her high school.    She used a stratified random sample to select $20$ students within each letter grade.  The information is displayed in the table below. Letter Grade In a relationship Not in a relationship Total A 8 12 20 B 11 9 20 C 13 7 20 D 10 10 20 F 6 14 20 Total 48 52 100 A ${ \chi}^{2}$ test of independence was conducted to determine whether the data above provides convincing evidence of an association between relationship status and overall letter grade.  The ${ \chi}^{2}$ test statistic  was $5.849$ with a $p$ -value of $0.211$ .  Which of the following statements is true?

choices.text: No relevant conclusion can be made because the data is not normally distributed.
Since the p p -value is greater than the significance level of α = 0.05 α = 0.05 , there is sufficient evidence to suggest relationship status and overall letter grade are independent.
Since the p p -value is greater than the significance level of α = 0.05 α = 0.05 , there is sufficient evidence to suggest relationship status and overall letter grade are dependent.
Since the p p -value is greater than the significance level of α = 0.05 α = 0.05 , there is insufficient evidence to suggest an association between relationship status and overall letter grade.
Since the p p -value is greater than the significance level of α = 0.05 α = 0.05 , there is sufficient evidence to suggest an association between relationship status and overall letter grade.
